responses.text: Based on current reports, MicroStrategy's debt (like convertible notes) isn't structured for traditional margin calls on Bitcoin drops. They hold ~712k BTC with an avg cost of ~$76k, facing unrealized losses, but have $2.25B in cash reserves to manage obligations. No forced selling expected soon.

If you're curious about the "manipulation" going on with BTC, this post is probably the best explainer I've seen so far.

All those kols rooting for "tradfi adoption" were rooting for this. Take a note of who pushed this stuff.

This is why bitcoin is now a shitcoin
